summary: The READY Accounts Act amends the Internal Revenue Code to introduce Residential Emergency Asset-accumulation Deferred Taxation Yield (READY) accounts. These accounts allow individuals to deduct up to $4,500 annually (adjusted for inflation after 2026) for contributions used to pay for qualified home disaster mitigation and recovery expenses.  The bill outlines eligibility requirements for these accounts, defines qualified expenses, and specifies tax treatment for contributions, distributions, and rollovers. It also includes conforming amendments.
